edu.iu.dsc.tws.data.api.splits

Class FileInputSplit<OT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.iu.dsc.tws.data.api.splits.LocatableInputSplit<OT>
      • edu.iu.dsc.tws.data.api.splits.FileInputSplit<OT>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InputSplit<OT>, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrowInputSplit, BinaryInputSplit, CSVInputSplit, DelimitedInputSplit

    public abstract class FileInputSplit<OT>
extends LocatableInputSplit<OT>
    A file input split provides information on a particular part of a file, possibly hosted on a distributed file system and replicated among several hosts.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      Obtains a DataInputStream in an thread that is not interrupted.

      • FileInputSplit

        public FileInputSplit(int num,
                      Path file,
                      long start,
                      long length,
                      java.lang.String[] hosts)
        Constructs a split with host information.
        Parameters:
        num - the number of this input split
        file - the file name
        start - the position of the first byte in the file to process
        length - the number of bytes in the file to process (-1 is flag for "read whole file")
        hosts - the list of hosts containing the block, possibly null

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: InputSplit
        Method that marks the end of the life-cycle of an input split. Should be used to close channels and streams and release resources. After this method returns without an error, the input is assumed to be correctly read.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the input could not be closed properly.

      • open

        public void open()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Opens an input stream to the file defined in the input format. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the given split.

        The stream is actually opened in an asynchronous thread to make sure any interruptions to the thread working on the input format do not reach the file system.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the spit could not be opened due to an I/O problem.

      • open

        public void open(Config cfg)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
